title: Conditions/Prerequisites of Salah
text:
2 Nine Prerequisites of a Salah

Being a Muslim
Being of Sound Mind
Being an adult (otherwise not obligatory)
Being free of ritual impurity
Removal of physical impurity
Awrah is covered at the time of Salah (correct clothing)
Doing within the designated time-window for each Salah
Facing the Qiblah (Mecca)
Making a correct intention

title: Prayer Guide for New Muslims
text:
This course is designed for new Muslims and for anyone who wants to refresh their understanding of Salah (the prayer).
We created this course at the London Central Mosque because many of the resources available today on videos, booklets and blogs can be overwhelming.
They often include:

Too many Sunnah (recommended) actions, which are not required for the Salah to be valid. 
Content exclusively in Arabic, which can make learning feel difficult and discouraging for non-Arabic speakers.
A lack of clear structure where many do not explain the difference between what’s essential and what’s optional, or how to build up your Salah step by step.

As a result, learning how to pray can feel confusing or take much longer than it should.

title: Prayer Guide for New Muslims
text:
What Makes This Course Different?
We focus on keeping it simple, practical and spiritually meaningful.
In this course, you will:

Learn the pillars and required actions of the Salah, what you need to do for your Salah to be valid.
Learn how to recite Surat Al-Fatihah, the essential chapter in every unit of Salah plus and Tashahud which is essential also.
Understand the basic rules related to Salah like cleanliness, direction, timing and join a congregation.
Discover the spiritual meaning of Salah like how it connects you with your Creator and brings peace to the heart.

Once you’ve learned the basics, you’ll be in a strong position to gradually add more Sunnah practices and deepen your Salah over time.
We hope this course helps you feel confident in your Salah and brings you closer to Allah, InShaAllah.

title: Importance of Salah
text:
As Muslims, our relationship with Allah is our top priority
At the heart of that relationship are the five daily Salaat.
When you pray, you are in a conversation with your Creator!
The second pillar of Islam and the only worship made obligatory in the seventh heaven. 







Build your life around good communication with your Creator, and your life will change for the better!

title: Importance of Salah
section: 2 Four Benefits of Salah From the Quran & the Sunnah
text:
2 Four Benefits of Salah From the Quran & the Sunnah

Removes evil and immorality from your life [29:45]
Washes away your sins [Sahih Bukahri 528; Muslim 667]
Calms your anxieties [70:19–23]
A source of peace, tranquillity and comfort [13:28][Abu-Dawood 4985]







Sunnah is a narration of the Prophet (SAW) that forms the basis of our understanding of Islam alongside the Quran. Sahih Bukhari and Muslim are two of the seven (?) main collections of Sunnah in which the narrations are considered authentic and reliable.
